member.summary: Append a whole object full of params to the dynamic EG: AddDynamicParams(new {A = 1, B = 2}) // will add property A and B to the dynamic

member.summary: Add all the parameters needed to the command just before it executes

member.summary: All the names of the param in the bag, use Get to yank them out

member.summary: Allows you to automatically populate a target property/field from output parameters. It actually creates an InputOutput parameter, so you can still pass data in.
member.param: The object whose property/field you wish to populate.
A MemberExpression targeting a property/field of the target (or descendant thereof.)
The size to set on the parameter. Defaults to 0, or DbString.DefaultLength in case of strings.
member.returns: The DynamicParameters instance

member.summary: Executes a query, returning the data typed as per T

member.name: P:Dapper.SqlMapper.ConnectionStringComparer
member.summary: How should connection strings be compared for equivalence? Defaults to StringComparer.Ordinal. Providing a custom implementation can be useful for allowing multi-tenancy databases with identical schema to share strategies. Note that usual equivalence rules apply: any equivalent connection strings MUST yield the same hash-code.

member.name: M:Dapper.SqlMapper.GetRowParser(System.Data.IDataReader,System.Type,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the row parser for a specific row on a data reader. This allows for type switching every row based on, for example, a TypeId column. You could return a collection of the base type but have each more specific.
member.param: The data reader to get the parser for the current row from
The type to get the parser for
The start column index of the object (default 0)
The length of columns to read (default -1 = all fields following startIndex)
Return null if we can't find the first column? (default false)
member.returns: A parser for this specific object from this row.

member.name: M:Dapper.SqlMapper.GetRowParser``1(System.Data.IDataReader,System.Type,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the row parser for a specific row on a data reader. This allows for type switching every row based on, for example, a TypeId column. You could return a collection of the base type but have each more specific.
member.param: The data reader to get the parser for the current row from
The type to get the parser for
The start column index of the object (default 0)
The length of columns to read (default -1 = all fields following startIndex)
Return null if we can't find the first column? (default false)
member.returns: A parser for this specific object from this row.

member.summary: Finds best constructor
member.returns: Matching constructor or default one

member.name: M:Dapper.SqlMapper.ITypeMap.FindExplicitConstructor
member.summary:
Returns a constructor which should *always* be used.
Parameters will be default values, nulls for reference types and zero'd for value types.
Use this class to force object creation away from parameterless constructors you don't control.

member.summary: Gets mapping for constructor parameter
member.returns: Mapping implementation

member.summary: Gets member mapping for column
member.returns: Mapping implementation

member.name: T:Dapper.SqlMapper.Link`2
member.summary: This is a micro-cache; suitable when the number of terms is controllable (a few hundred, for example), and strictly append-only; you cannot change existing values. All key matches are on **REFERENCE** equality. The type is fully thread-safe.

member.name: T:Dapper.SqlMapper.LiteralToken
member.summary: Represents a placeholder for a value that should be replaced as a literal value in the resulting sql

member.name: P:Dapper.SqlMapper.LiteralToken.Token
member.summary: The text in the original command that should be replaced

member.name: P:Dapper.SqlMapper.LiteralToken.Member
member.summary: The name of the member referred to by the token

member.name: T:Dapper.SqlMapper.Settings
member.summary: Permits specifying certain SqlMapper values globally.

member.name: M:Dapper.SqlMapper.Settings.SetDefaults
member.summary: Resets all Settings to their default values

member.name: P:Dapper.SqlMapper.Settings.CommandTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the default Command Timeout for all Queries

member.name: P:Dapper.SqlMapper.Settings.ApplyNullValues
member.summary: Indicates whether nulls in data are silently ignored (default) vs actively applied and assigned to members

member.name: P:Dapper.SqlMapper.Settings.PadListExpansions
member.summary: Should list expansions be padded with null-valued parameters, to prevent query-plan saturation? For example, an 'in @foo' expansion with 7, 8 or 9 values will be sent as a list of 10 values, with 3, 2 or 1 of them null. The padding size is relative to the size of the list; "next 10" under 150, "next 50" under 500, "next 100" under 1500, etc.
member.remarks: Caution: this should be treated with care if your DB provider (or the specific configuration) allows for null equality (aka "ansi nulls off"), as this may change the intent of your query; as such, this is disabled by default and must be enabled.

member.name: P:Dapper.SqlMapper.Settings.InListStringSplitCount
member.summary: If set (non-negative), when performing in-list expansions of integer types ("where id in @ids", etc), switch to a string_split based operation if there are more than this many elements. Note that this feautre requires SQL Server 2016 / compatibility level 130 (or above).
